Name: Running
Description: Running is the action of rapidly propelling yourself forward on foot. When running, there is a moment where both feet are off of the ground (as opposed to walking, when one foot is always on the ground), making it a high-impact exercise.

Name: Walking
Description: Move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once.

Name: Biking
Description: Propelling oneself on a bicycle using the feet and legs.

Name: Hiking
Description: Hiking is a long, vigorous walk, usually on trails or footpaths in the countryside.

Name: Rollerblading
Description: A form of cardio exercise, inline skating is also good for building strength endurance, especially in your thighs and glutes.

Name: Rowing
Description: An exercise where the purpose is to strengthen the back muscles that draw the rower's arms toward the body.

Name: Swimming
Description: The propulsion of the body through water by combined arm and leg motions and the natural flotation of the body.

Name: Water Aerobics
Description: Water aerobics is a form of aerobic exercise that requires water-immersed participants.

Name: Bicep Curls
Description: Hold a dumbbell with your palm facing upward. Slowly curl the weight up by bending your elbow.

Name: Lat Pull Downs
Description: While seated, you pull a hanging bar toward you to reach chin level, then release it back up with control for one repetition.

Name: Dead Lift
Description: Hips hinge backward to lower down and pick up a weighted barbell or kettlebell from the floor.

Name: TRX
Description: Suspension training that uses body weight exercises to develop strength, balance, flexibility and core stability simultaneously.

Name: Squats
Description: Bending at the knee, lower to a position in which the torso is erect and the knees are deeply bent and then rises to an upright position.

Name: Leg Press
Description: In a seated position, repeatedly press your feet against weights, which can be adjusted according to your fitness level.

Name: Leg Extension
Description: Sit with a weighted pad on top of your lower legs then use your quads to repeatedly extend your knees and lift your lower legs.

Name: Leg Curl
Description: Bend your knees and move your heels toward your glutes while the rest of your body stays still. Typically done with added weights for resistance.

Name: Standing Calf Raise
Description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the muscle groups in your lower legs.

Name: Seated Calf Raise
Description: From a seated position, bring your feet back, so your heels are behind your knees. Lift your heels up off the floor, coming up on to your toes.

Name: Bench Press
Description: Lay on a bench and press weight upward using either a barbell or a pair of dumbbells.

Name: Chest Fly
Description: A variation of the standard bench press that is performed by lying on a flat bench with a weight in each hand.

Name: Push-up
Description: In a prone position, palms planted below the shoulders, balls of feet on the floor, push the body up and let it down by straightening and bending the arms.

Name: Shoulder Press
Description: An upper body strength training movement, traditionally performed with dumbbells or a barbell.

Name: Leg Raise
Description: While keeping your legs straight, lift your legs a couple inches off the ground, and point your toes away from your body.

Name: Back Extension
Description: An isolation exercise that mainly targets your low back.

Name: Hip Extension
Description: Extend or hip joint so that the angle between the pelvis and thigh increases.

Name: Single Leg Squat
Description: A squat movement that's performed on only one leg.

Name: Yoga
Description: Using physical postures, breathing exercises, and meditation to improve overall health.

Name: Lunges
Description: Step forward, lower the body toward the ground, and return to the starting position.

Name: Hip Flexion
Description: Hip flexion happens every time you step, squat, sit, and revolve on a bike.

Name: Knee Flexion
Description: Knee flexion is a movement that decreases the angle between your thigh and your shin.

Name: Knee Extension
Description: The knee extension is an exercise you can do with a weight machine to work the muscle on the front of the thigh.

Name: Side Leg Raise
Description: Side leg raises is a core and leg exercise that involves you lying on the floor on your side, and abducting your leg (pushing them) away from the midline

Name: Plantar Flexion
Description: Movement of the foot in a downward motion away from the body.
